content.description: P1: An easy 5.7 pitch gets you through ledges to a belay ledge.   P2:A handfull of knife blades gets you out the lip of the roof above to a ledge.   P3: Climb up to a large roof. Difficult nailing on some very thin wafers will get you out the roof and finish.
content.location: Starts about 35' right of Hate Crimes.

climbs.name: Hate Crimes (aka Auschwitz Direct)
climbs.fa: Forrest Gardner, Jay Bell -1987  FFA:  Mark Cartwright, Todd Wells - 2002

content.description:
Formerly a Forrest Gardner/Jay Bell aid line, Auschwitz Direct was freed as Hate Crimes in 2002 by Mark Cartwright and Todd Wells. 

  P1:Climb a nice offwidth that leads to hands and fingers.   P2:A short unnerving pitch through a bad section of shale to a thank God ledge.   P3:Climbing left through some nasty rotten overhanging rock to a roof. Climb through the roof to the top.
content.protection: Aid gear and traditional pro. Guts.
content.location: Starts about 500' right of the landslide; shares start with Battle Wagon.

content.description: Pitch 1 climb up the face to a roof. Climb out the roof into a very nice right facing corner and up to the large tree ledge Pitch 2 is a very short pitch which is mainly done to shelter the belay. Climb up chossy rock and around the corner left to belay next to a small empress tree. Pitch 3 climb right of the arete up steep loose face taking your time to find adequate protection. Climb up the large slot and mantle left the huge protruding rock onto the prow. Continue up face to the top
content.protection: A single rack from 00-3. A #5 cam can be placed while in the large slot before the overhang. Double on .4/.5 might be nice. Half ropes on routes like this increase safety margins.
content.location: This is on the left side of the buttress left of hate crimes direct

content.description: Though it shares the approach with the Upper Passes' Main Wall, climbing at the Auschwitz Buttress tends to be more adventurous due to lower rock quality.  Wear a helmet!
